ResponseText: That is an argument from ignorance. Arguments from ignorance can be identified by observing the 'missing' dichotomy premise. /A quantum fluctuation such as one that hypothetically created all known non-exotic matter could not exist within the quantum states allowed by observable space-time. //Therefore the big bang quantum fluctuation arose from nothing Is demonstrably invalid, note the single premise. The 'missing' premise is shown in the following: /A quantum fluctuation such as one that hypothetically created all known non-exotic matter could not exist within the quantum states allowed by observable space-time. /If the big bang quantum fluctuation did not occur in observable space time it arose from nothing. //Therefore the big bang quantum fluctuation arose from nothing The second premise if false, making the whole argument unsound, specifically the fallacy of a false dichotomy.
